TopicTitle: How to find out memory usage by individual mods

Articles.Content:
Hi everybody

Am currently trying to choose which mods to use/retain in order to run win32 KSP (with B9 Aerospace and Kerbal Joint Reinforcement among them as my "need to have" mods )

Is there a way/mod/tool that can display how much memory each mod is using?

I have New Horizons and Outer Planets Mod installed for my "universe" :"> which I think uses a lot of memory, TALC, MKS/OKS, KIS-KAS, Universal Storage, a couple of rocket parts and a few utility mods (ATM, Texture Replacer, etc).

Thanks in advance.
Any different from this thread right below: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129081-How-can-I-find-out-which-mod-is-eating-my-RAM

Any different from this thread right below: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129081-How-can-I-find-out-which-mod-is-eating-my-RAM

Thanks FancyMouse for the link to the thread about my question. Think I need to do keyword search better before asking my questions.
